Help_Visualize_Content: Explore data flow between objects. Nodes represent tables, views, SPs, and functions. Color-coded by schema.
Help_Navigate_Content: Drag to pan, Ctrl+scroll to zoom. Toggle LR/TB layout. Use minimap for large graphs.
Help_Search_Content: Find objects by name in the toolbar. Right-click any node to view its DDL.
Help_Filter_Content: Filter by schema or object type. Hide isolated nodes. Mark focus schemas to show connected objects only.
Help_Trace_Content: Right-click a node to trace upstream or downstream dependencies. Double-click for quick 1-level trace.
Help_Config_Content: Configure connection, data model classification, and preferences in Settings (ribbon).
Help_DataSource_Content: Connects via GraphQL to a Fabric SQL Database. A Notebook parses DDL to compute lineage edges.
Help_Developer_Content: Parser extracts table references (FROM, JOIN, INSERT, EXEC) via regex. Customize patterns in the Notebook.
DQChecker_Help_Overview: DQ Checker validates data quality in your Fabric Data Warehouses using Soda Core. Define checks, group them into test cases, and run scans to ensure data meets your quality standards.
DQChecker_Help_DataSources_Content: Go to the Data Sources tab and add your Fabric Data Warehouse connection. DQ Checker will discover schemas, tables, and columns automatically.
DQChecker_Help_Checks_Content: Use the Checks tab to create data quality checks. Choose from 22+ templates: row counts, null checks, range validation, foreign key checks, freshness, schema validation, and custom SQL.
DQChecker_Help_Results_Content: After running a scan, view results in the Results tab. See pass/fail status, metrics, and trends over time. Drill into failed checks to understand issues.
DQChecker_Help_Scans_Content: Execute scans using a Fabric Python Notebook. The notebook reads check definitions, generates SodaCL YAML, runs the scan, and writes results back to the database.
DQChecker_Help_Settings_Content: Click Settings in the ribbon to set default values for owner, severity, DQ dimension, and tags. These defaults pre-populate when creating new checks.
DQChecker_Help_CheckTypes_Core: Core: row_count, missing_count, missing_percent, duplicate_count, duplicate_percent, min, max, avg, sum, invalid_count, invalid_percent, valid_count, avg_length, min_length
DQChecker_Help_CheckTypes_Advanced: Advanced: freshness, schema, reference, custom_sql, user_defined, scalar_comparison
DQChecker_Settings_DefaultsDescription: These defaults are applied when creating new checks.
DQChecker_About_Description: DQ Checker is a Microsoft Fabric workload for automated data quality validation. It uses Soda Core to execute quality checks against your Fabric Data Warehouses, supporting 22+ check templates including completeness, accuracy, uniqueness, validity, and freshness checks.
Database_Changed_Message: Switched to new database and reloaded data
Settings_NoItem: No item to save settings to
Settings_SavedMessage: Your settings have been saved successfully
Settings_DemoModeHint: Use pre-generated sample data (138 objects) for demonstration without database connection
Settings_GraphQLDisabledHint: Disabled in Demo Mode - turn off Demo Mode to use GraphQL
Settings_GraphQLHint: Get this from your GraphQL API item in the Fabric Portal
Settings_Step2: Run schema-ddl.sql to create tables and views
Settings_Step3: Generate sample data: EXEC meta.sp_generate_sample_data @source_name = 'My DWH';
Settings_Step4: Create GraphQL API exposing meta.vw_* views
Settings_Step5: Copy the endpoint URL and paste above
Settings_ClassificationDesc: Define name prefixes to classify objects. Objects are matched in order, first match wins.
Settings_DefaultDesc: Catches all objects not matching above patterns
Settings_ExcludeSyntax: Use % as wildcard: "vw%" = starts with, "%_backup" = ends with, "%dim%" = contains
Settings_ShowMinimapDesc: Show navigation minimap on the canvas
Settings_ShowControlsDesc: Show zoom buttons on the canvas
Settings_EdgeTypeDesc: Line style for connections between objects
Settings_RememberFiltersDesc: Save filter selections when closing the item
Settings_DefaultTraceLevelsDesc: Right-click on a node triggers trace with these levels
